Class PgnHolder

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.pgn.PgnHolder
public class PgnHolder extends Object
A proxy for accessing a Portable Game Notation (PGN) file. The PGN holder can be used to optimize the way the contents of the file are retrieved, and also to abstract the common operations that can be performed with the file, such as saving to the PGN file the games held into memory, as well as retrieving the metadata stored in the PGN.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PgnHolder(String filename)
    Constructs a new PGN holder using the provided filename as a reference to the PGN file.

    • countGamesInPgnFile

      public long countGamesInPgnFile() throws IOException
      Counts the games present in the PGN file.

      It does not load the contents of the file, but rather checks into the data how many events are persisted. In order to do so, the implementation counts the mandatory PGN tags.

      Returns:
      the number of games in PGN file
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of error reading the PGN file

    • loadPgn

      public void loadPgn(LargeFile file) throws Exception
      Loads into memory the chess data stored in the given PGN file.
      Parameters:
      file - the PGN file to load
      Throws:
      Exception - in case of error loading the contents of the file

    • loadPgn

      public void loadPgn(String pgn)
      Loads into memory the chess data of the given PGN, provided as a raw string representation.
      Parameters:
      pgn - the raw string representing the contents of a PGN

    • savePgn

      public void savePgn()
      Saves to the PGN file the current data stored in the holder.

    • getSize

      public Integer getSize()
      Returns the number of games stored in holder.
      Returns:
      the number of games

    • isLazyLoad

      public boolean isLazyLoad()
      Checks if the PGN contents are loaded lazily.

      N.B.: at the moment lazy loading is not enabled and this flag has no impact on the behavior of the class.

      Returns:
      true if the PGN contents are loaded lazily

    • setLazyLoad

      public void setLazyLoad(boolean lazyLoad)
      Sets whether to activate lazy loading or not.

      N.B.: at the moment lazy loading is not enabled and this flag has no impact on the behavior of the class.

      Parameters:
      lazyLoad - true to activate lazy loading

    • getListener

      public List<PgnLoadListener> getListener()
      Returns the list of observers to the PGN loading events. The list can be used to add other listeners or remove existing ones.
      Returns:
      the listeners to PGN loading events
